data.text:
Car and Driver is the definitive voice and essential resource for automotive enthusiasts and industry leads alike. Journalistic focus on performance and technology. Dedicated to delivering leading-edge reporting on all things related to automobiles. Offers uncontested authority, penetrating insight and proven foresight on where the industry is moving and how that will impact drivers.

SUBSCRIBE NOW AND GET YOUR FIRST ISSUE FREE! Don't forget, you can also get free access to issues with a timed preview (on your iPhone, too!).

Plus, share app content with your favorite social networks. Using a simple two-finger tap, actual images of the content itself are âclippedâ and can be sent directly to Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or Pinterest, or via email or saved to your photo roll.

Download our free app today! Select the issue you'd like to purchase, or sign up with a subscription and save!

Please note that you must have iOS 10.0 or higher installed on your device to use this app.

Car and Driver Magazine US Pricing:

â¢ Subscription 1 Month - USD 1.99*

â¢ Subscription 1 Year - USD 19.99*

* For non-US app stores, the equivalent currency charges will apply.

Please note: App subscriptions do not include access to subscription-only content on our website.

Additional Subscription Information:

â¢ Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase.

â¢ Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

â¢ Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal.

â¢ Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase.

â¢ No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during active subscription period.

Privacy Policy - https://bit.ly/2J5Ujfh

Terms of Use - https://bit.ly/2J1YZqL

â¢ Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

DyreLogan ,

Politics meets automotive

I subscribed to Car and Driver in hopes to receive information about cars, read about cars and be excited about cars, but instead I was greeted with the same old politics forcing information on electric cars (which cannot be handled on our grids and is lacking in charging stations).

I donât care about electric cars. I am not rich enough for electric cars. There arenât enough charging stations where I live or in the country where I live to where I would even think about getting an electric car. Keep the politics out of it and just give me information about cars.

Donât force feed electric car garbage in these magazines. I AM paying for this magazine (which I donât plan on continuing if next months installment has electric car ads and articles) so I want to see cars I can afford, that take gasoline, that are not destroying the environment as spoiled kids keep speaking about while they take private jets to their next big lecture shaming people who own SUVâs and other vehicles.

I want to read about proper cars. Get on the ball and give me articles about cars, Car and Driver. Electric cars will never grace my driveway. I will never spend a dime on these powerless atrocities.
